summary: A letter from Mark Anthony Taylor to Mel Stride, Chairman of the UK Treasury Select Committee, alleging a cover-up regarding Jes Staley's conduct at JP Morgan in relation to Jeffrey Epstein. The letter accuses the TSC, FCA, and SFO of suppressing evidence and failing to investigate, and makes serious allegations of corruption, blackmail, and judicial interference.

persons.name: Mark Anthony Taylor
persons.context: Author of the letter making allegations of cover-up regarding Jes Staley's conduct and connections to Jeffrey Epstein. Claims his friend was murdered for exposing the story and that he has been gagged by court orders.

persons.name: Mel Stride
persons.role: Chairman of the UK Treasury Select Committee
persons.context: Recipient of the letter. Accused of personal responsibility for the TSC withholding key legal evidence from ongoing inquiries regarding Jes Staley and Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Maciej Wenerski
persons.context: Handled the author's previous correspondence as a FOIA request, replying a month later.

persons.name: Jes Staley
persons.role: Former CEO of Barclays, Former JP Morgan Executive
persons.context: Central figure in the allegations. His conduct while at JP Morgan is under investigation by the FBI, FCA, and PRA in relation to Jeffrey Epstein. Accused of being blackmailed by Epstein and being unfit for his banking roles.

persons.name: Andrew Bailey
persons.role: Head of the Financial Conduct Authority (FCA)
persons.context: Accused of explicitly refusing to investigate Jes Staley after being supplied with FOIA responses. His FCA has a 98% public disapproval rating. Being considered for a top job at the Bank of England while also under investigation for the LC&F scandal.

persons.name: Lisa Osofsky
persons.role: Head of the Serious Fraud Office (SFO)
persons.context: Accused of explicitly refusing to investigate Jes Staley after being supplied with FOIA responses. Allegedly needed to be corrupted for Staley to keep his job.

persons.name: Mark Carney
persons.context: Mentioned as being investigated alongside Andrew Bailey for the LC&F scandal.

persons.name: Judge Worster
persons.context: Allegedly refused to accept the author's emails as evidence, stonewalled him, and served two restraining orders against him. The orders blocked the truth about Staley from being validated in a legal document. Questioned about taking a bribe.

persons.name: Ian Burnett
persons.context: Allegedly would need to be 'in the loop' if Staley bribed a judge. Lord Etherton implied Burnett was a paedophile. Questioned if he was 'Epstein's pick'.

persons.name: Lord Etherton
persons.context: Allegedly implied that Lord Chief Justice Ian Burnett was a paedophile.

persons.name: Lord Adrian PIE Fulford
persons.context: Mentioned as someone Ian Burnett works with, making Burnett 'highly suspect' in the author's view.

persons.name: Paul Kemaghan
persons.context: Mentioned as someone Ian Burnett works with, making Burnett 'highly suspect' in the author's view.

persons.name: Roger Jenkins
persons.context: Mentioned as someone who also appears to have gone to Epstein's child-rape parties. The author asks if the FCA was asked to investigate him.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Central to the allegations. Accused of blackmailing Jes Staley and Parliament. His emails are key evidence held by the TSC and JP Morgan.

connections.description: Staley is under investigation for his conduct at JP Morgan in relation to Epstein. The author alleges Staley was blackmailed by Epstein.
Bailey, as head of the FCA, explicitly refused to investigate Staley after being supplied with evidence, according to the author.
Osofsky, as head of the SFO, explicitly refused to investigate Staley after being supplied with evidence, according to the author.
Stride, as TSC Chairman, is accused of personal responsibility for the TSC withholding key evidence about Staley from investigators.
Judge Worster served two restraining orders against Taylor, blocking him from publicly validating information about Staley in court.
The author speculates that if Staley bribed a judge (Worster), Burnett as Lord Chief Justice would need to be 'in the loop'.
The author alleges Jenkins attended Epstein's 'child-rape parties'.

events.title: Previous Correspondence to TSC
events.description: Mark Anthony Taylor sent a previous email to Mel Stride and the Treasury Select Committee regarding Jes Staley and Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Friend's Murder for Expos√©
events.description: The author's friend was allegedly murdered for exposing the Epstein and Staley story. The timing and contents were given as evidence to Judge Worster.

events.title: Staley Should Have Been Dismissed
events.description: According to the author, blackmail emails from Epstein should have been enough to have Jes Staley dismissed from his position in 2015.

events.title: Letter Alleging Cover-Up
events.description: Mark Anthony Taylor sends this letter to Mel Stride, making wide-ranging allegations of a cover-up by the TSC, FCA, SFO, and judiciary regarding Jes Staley's connections to Jeffrey Epstein.

locations: Kalamata Billington Lane Derrington Stafford ST18 9LR (Author's address)
keyFacts: The Treasury Select Committee (TSC) has allegedly possessed Jeffrey Epstein's emails related to Jes Staley for almost five years without demanding an FCA investigation.
Andrew Bailey (FCA) and Lisa Osofsky (SFO) explicitly refused to investigate Jes Staley after being supplied with FOIA responses regarding Epstein.
The author alleges his friend was murdered in 2017 for exposing the Epstein and Staley story, and Judge Worster blocked this evidence with restraining orders.
The author suggests Jeffrey Epstein may have blackmailed Parliament to install Jes Staley at Barclays and to secure the positions of Andrew Bailey and Lisa Osofsky.
Roger Jenkins is alleged to have attended Epstein's 'child-rape parties', and the author questions why the FCA hasn't investigated him.
